intro: Ophiorrhiza extenuata, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of tropical trees. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and white or yellowish flowers. The plant has a short, creeping stem and produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. It is found in Southeast Asia and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its parasitic nature allows it to draw water and nutrients from its host, while still performing photosynthesis.
